title: Chappell Roan’s Recent Smash Returns To Its All-Time Peak As Her Latest Debuts
description: Chappell Roan’s “The Subway” debuts at No. 1 on the U.K. Singles and Streaming charts, while "The Giver" returns to its peak and "Good Luck, Babe!" surges into the top 10.
content:
Chappell Roan’s new single “The Subway” has become another breakout smash for the multi-genre singer-songwriter. The tune opens in impressive positions on a number of charts in the United Kingdom and even manages to become another leader for the Grammy winner.

As “The Subway” gets off to a strong start, the excitement generated by the new release helps several of Roan’s most famous tracks become bestsellers again.

Earlier in 2025, Roan delivered “The Giver,” her first single since winning the Grammy for Best New Artist. That track — which helped her venture into country for the first time — rises from No. 5 to No. 2 on the Official Physical Singles chart.

That position marks the all-time high for “The Giver” on the U.K.’s list of the bestselling tracks available on any physical format. The cut has reached the runner-up spot before, and “The Subway” helps it find its way there again.

Roan fills a pair of spaces inside the highest tier on the Official Physical Singles chart this week. As “The Giver” improves from No. 5 to No. 2, “Good Luck, Babe!” — which helped Roan establish a global fanbase — ascends from No. 12 to No. 10. The pop superstar almost claims a trio of top 10 hits on the Official Physical Singles roster, but “Pink Pony Club” just misses out on helping her accomplish that feat, as it dips from No. 10 to No. 11.

“The Subway” has clearly played a role in where “Good Luck, Babe!” and “The Giver” appear on the Official Physical Singles chart, even though Roan’s latest release has not yet become available on any physical format, so it’s not even eligible for the list it seems to be impacting in a roundabout way.

“The Subway” leads both the Official Singles and Official Singles Streaming charts. Roan doubles her total number of champions on the main ranking of the most consumed songs in the U.K. and scores her first leader on the streaming-only tally. The track also launches at No. 3 on both the Official Singles Sales and Official Singles Downloads rosters.
summary: Chappell Roan's latest single, "The Subway," has become a major hit in the UK, opening in several charts and becoming another leader. The song is followed by "The Giver," which rose from No. 5 to No. 2 on the Official Physical Singles chart, marking a new all-time high for the song. The release has also helped several of Roan’s most famous tracks become bestsellers again. Despite not yet available on any physical format, "the Subway" leads both the Official Singles and Official Sunde.
shortSummary: Chappell Roan’s new single "The Subway" launches as a major chart success, boosting several of her most famous tracks become bestsellers again in the UK.
argos_summary: Chappell Roan's new single "The Subway" has become a breakout hit, topping the UK's Official Singles and Streaming charts and boosting sales of her earlier tracks. The release has propelled "The Giver" from No.5 to No.2 on the Official Physical Singles chart, marking its highest position ever, while "Good Luck, Babe!" climbed from No.12 to No.10. Although "The Subway" itself is not yet available in physical format, its popularity has indirectly lifted Roan's other songs on the charts. The single also debuted at No.3 on both the Official Singles Sales and Downloads lists, further solidifying Roan's chart dominance.
